item.title: The 2013 Screen Actors Guild Nominees Are…
item.dc:creator: ET Online
item.description: Busy Philipps and Taye Diggs took to the Pacific Design Center stage in Los Angeles, CA this morning to announce the 19th Annual Screen Actors Guild nominees, and Lincoln tied with Silver Linings Playbook for most nominations (4). Over on the TV side, Homeland continued to take the drama lead (3 nominations) while Modern Family still has a firm grip on the comedy categories. Check
item.content:encoded:
Busy Philipps and Taye Diggs took to the Pacific Design Center stage in Los Angeles, CA this morning to announce the 19th Annual Screen Actors Guild nominees, and Lincoln tied with Silver Linings Playbook for most nominations (4).

Over on the TV side, Homeland continued to take the drama lead (3 nominations) while Modern Family still has a firm grip on the comedy categories. Check out all the nominees!

RELATED – 2012 Independent Spirit Award Nominations

Best Ensemble
Argo
Les Miserables
Lincoln
Silver Linings Playbook
Best Exotic Marigold Hotel

Best Actor
Bradley Cooper, Silver Linings Playbook
Daniel Day-Lewis, Lincoln
John Hawkes, The Sessions
Hugh Jackman, Les Miserables
Denzel Washington, Flight

Best Actress
Jessica Chastain, Zero Dark Thirty
Marion Cotillard, Rust & Bone
Jennifer Lawrence, Silver Linings Playbook
Helen Mirren, Hitchcock
Naomi Watts, The Impossible

Best Supporting Actor
Alan Arkin, Argo
Javier Bardem, Skyfall
Robert De Niro, Silver Linings Playbook
Phillip Seymour Hoffman, The Master
Tommy Lee Jones, Lincoln

Best Supporting Actress
Sally Field, Lincoln
Anne Hathaway, Les Miserables
Helen Hunt, The Sessions
Nicole Kidman, The Paperboy
Maggie Smith, The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel

Best TV Ensemble, Drama
Boardwalk Empire
Breaking Bad
Downton Abbey
Homeland
Mad Men

Best TV Ensemble, Comedy
30 Rock
The Big Bang Theory
Glee
Modern Family
Nurse Jackie
The Office

Best TV Actor, Drama
Steve Buscemi, Boardwalk Empire
Bryan Cranston, Breaking Bad
Jeff Daniels, The Newsroom
Jon Hamm, Mad Men
Damian Lewis, Homeland

Best TV Actress, Drama
Claire Danes, Homeland
Michelle Dockery, Downton Abbey
Jessica Lange, American Horror Story: Asylum
Julianna Margulies, The Good Wife
Maggie Smith, Downton Abbey

Best TV Actor, Comedy
Alec Baldwin, 30 Rock
Ty Burrell, Modern Family
Louis CK, Louie
Jim Parsons, The Big Bang Theory
Eric Stonestreet, Modern Family

Best TV Actress, Comedy
Edie Falco, Nurse Jackie
Tina Fey, 30 Rock
Amy Poehler, Parks & Recreation
Sofia Vergara, Modern Family
Betty White, Hot in Cleveland

Best Actor, Made for TV Movie/Miniseries
Kevin Costner, Hatfields & McCoys
Woody Harrelson, Game Change
Ed Harris, Game Change
Clive Owen, Hemingway & Gelhorn
Bill Paxton, Hatfields & McCoys

Best Actress, Made for TV Movie/Miniseries
Nicole Kidman, Hemingway & Gelhorn
Julianne Moore, Game Change
Charlotte Rampling, Restless
Sigourney Weaver, Political Animals
Alfre Woodard, Steel Magnolias

The 19th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards will air live on January 27 on TNT & TBS.

item.title: Seth Rogen and Babs Turn the Tables on Rick
item.dc:creator: Chandra Price
item.description: ET Canada‘s Rick Campanelli jetted to LA to interview the legendary Barbra Streisand and her Canadian-born The Guilt Trip co-star, Seth Rogen, about their new comedy, when the actor suddenly got starstruck over our co-host. “He knows everybody,” Babs said. “I grew up watching him,” Seth explains to his onscreen mother. Ironically, before the chat,
item.content:encoded:
ET Canada‘s Rick Campanelli jetted to LA to interview the legendary Barbra Streisand and her Canadian-born The Guilt Trip co-star, Seth Rogen, about their new comedy, when the actor suddenly got starstruck over our co-host.

“He knows everybody,” Babs said. “I grew up watching him,” Seth explains to his onscreen mother.

Ironically, before the chat, Rick had earlier Tweeted about his excitement over meeting with Barbra: “I’m minutes away from chatting with the legend Barbara Streisand… Kinda got the butterflies right about now.”

And then the interview took a detour with Seth actually reviewing Rick’s resume with the icon. “Seth likes to call me ‘Rick The Temp,’” he tells the very curious Babs. Peaking her interest, she asks, “Rick The Temp? The temp?”

Seth further describes the gig that first shot Rick to fame, “He was yeah, he was on the music channel in Canada. Literally all throughout when I was in high school.” Barbra was pleasantly surprised, “Oh my God.”

“They used to have a contest where you could temp and be like an on-air personality. And he won and was on for years,” said the funnyman. Of course, Rick The Temp was on MuchMusic for years before coming on board as co-host at ET Canada.

The conversation naturally progressed into how the acting duo came about, with Rick asking, “So you two come from these two totally different generations of actors. What made you want to get together and…” Before he finished, Babs quipped: “Exactly that.”

Meanwhile, Seth said how “it was interesting to work with someone from a different generation of acting… and a legend. But she hates it.” Barbra modestly admits, “I know, I do.”

After the memorable discussion, Rick Tweeted, “She’s as sweet as a “mom”. SO NICE! She & Seth Rogen are amazing in The Guilt Trip.”

For a sneak peek of the interview watch below! And for more from Seth and Babs on their new flick The Guilt Trip, watch ET Canada tonight!

item.title: Watch 5 Minutes From The Spice Girls Musical
item.dc:creator: ET Online
item.description: While American audiences have yet to learn if Viva Forever!, a new musical utilizing music by The Spice Girls, will hit our shores, a five minute sizzle reel has gone online, giving everyone their first look at the jukebox musical. RELATED – 2012 Was The Year of Pop Group Revivals! According to the press release,
item.content:encoded:
While American audiences have yet to learn if Viva Forever!, a new musical utilizing music by The Spice Girls, will hit our shores, a five minute sizzle reel has gone online, giving everyone their first look at the jukebox musical.

RELATED – 2012 Was The Year of Pop Group Revivals!

According to the press release, Viva Forever! is a romantic comedy that tells the story of a family thrown into chaos, as Viva (played by Hannah John-Kamen) and her three best friends get swept up in a TV talent show where stars are born and dreams are shattered.

Watching from the sidelines is Viva’s mother, Lauren (played by Sally Ann Triplett), who is one half of the musical’s heart. And part of the show-stopping rendition of Mama, which underscores everything Viva Forever! is about.

Watch the footage below and click here for more information about Viva Forever! which is currently playing at the Piccadilly Theatre in London’s West End.

More Links:

Angelina Jolie To Quit Acting
Isabelle Allen Beams Over ‘Les Mis’ Role
Prince William Attends Charity Event Without Kate
SAGs Flashback ’98: Jolie Experiences the Reward

item.title: Darren Criss Performs For Free
item.dc:creator: Kate Morawetz
item.description: Gleeks rejoice! Fan favourite Darren Criss – who plays Blaine Anderson on Glee – treated fans in New York City by performing a free, outdoor concert. Darren belted out holidays tunes such as “White Christmas”, “Rockin’ Around the Christmas Tree”, “Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas”, “The Christmas Song (Chestnuts Roasting on an Open Fire)&#
item.content:encoded:
Gleeks rejoice! Fan favourite Darren Criss – who plays Blaine Anderson on Glee – treated fans in New York City by performing a free, outdoor concert.

Darren belted out holidays tunes such as “White Christmas”, “Rockin’ Around the Christmas Tree”, “Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas”, “The Christmas Song (Chestnuts Roasting on an Open Fire)” and “Christmas Don’t Be Late” at the busy intersection of 9th Avenue and 14th Street in Manhattan.

The dreary weather didn’t stop Darren or his fans, some reserving themselves a spot by sleeping overnight and others flying in from Toronto to get a glimpse of the 25-year-old actor-musician in action!

Watch the Glee star perform below and don’t forget to catch the next episode of Glee on Global, Thursday at 9 p.m. ET!

item.title: Lohan Skips Court To Tour With The Wanted
item.dc:creator: Kate Morawetz
item.description: It looks like Lindsay Lohan will be running from the law a little longer. The Liz & Dick actress will not be showing up for a court date Wednesday in LA pertaining to her summer car accident, as she’s instead opting to jet oversees with five new men in her life. LiLo doesn’t have to
item.content:encoded:
It looks like Lindsay Lohan will be running from the law a little longer. The Liz & Dick actress will not be showing up for a court date Wednesday in LA pertaining to her summer car accident, as she’s instead opting to jet oversees with five new men in her life.

LiLo doesn’t have to show up to court as the charges pending against her are misdemeanours and her attorney Shawn Holley will be there to represent her. Lindsay’s facing counts of willingly resisting, obstructing or delaying an officer in the course of their duties, providing false information to an officer; and reckless driving stemming from the aftermath of her June 8 smash-up on the Pacific Coast Highway.

But for not, she’s off to London and then Dubai with her new rumoured flame, Max George, and his band mates from The Wanted.

Tweet us your thoughts on whether or not Lindsay’s taking her trouble with the law seriously enough.

Other news making your Entertainment Fix: Anne Hathaway brought a little danger to the Les Miserables red carpet, wearing thigh-high Vegan Tom Ford heels, Tom Cruise says his new film Jack Reacher is both action-packed and funny. And find out which ET Canada host Seth Rogen got a little starstruck in front of at the LA screening of The Guilt Trip.

item.title: Countdown to Barbara Walters’ ‘Most Fascinating’
item.dc:creator: ET Online
item.description: Who will be crowned with the top title this year? We’re just days away from learning who topped Barbara Walter’s 2012 catalogue of Most Fascinating, and tomorrow on ET Walters gives us a sneak peek at the interviews with the personalities featured on her highly anticipated list. Related: Barbara Walters Reveals Partial List of 2012′s
item.content:encoded:
Who will be crowned with the top title this year?

We’re just days away from learning who topped Barbara Walter’s 2012 catalogue of Most Fascinating, and tomorrow on ET Walters gives us a sneak peek at the interviews with the personalities featured on her highly anticipated list.

Related: Barbara Walters Reveals Partial List of 2012′s ‘Most Fascinating People’

Also Tuesday, more on the death of the hospital nurse who cared for Duchess Kate Middleton. Plus, Dwayne Johnson sits down for an exclusive interview with Nancy O’Dell.

item.title: New Trailer: ‘The Lone Ranger’
item.dc:creator: ET Online
item.description: Johnny Depp and director Gore Verbinski have had nothing but good luck working together (Pirates of the Caribbean 1-3, Rango) and that lucky streak looks to continue with their fifth collaboration, The Lone Ranger. RELATED – Depp Meets With Navajo Leaders Depp, who plays Tonto, is paired with Armie Hammer, as the titular mask wearing lawman, in bringing the
item.content:encoded:
Johnny Depp and director Gore Verbinski have had nothing but good luck working together (Pirates of the Caribbean 1-3, Rango) and that lucky streak looks to continue with their fifth collaboration, The Lone Ranger.

RELATED – Depp Meets With Navajo Leaders

Depp, who plays Tonto, is paired with Armie Hammer, as the titular mask wearing lawman, in bringing the classic TV show to life and now a more substantial trailer for the 2013 release has been unveiled, giving audiences a much grander idea of what’s in store for us come July 4 weekend.

Watch the trailer below!

item.title: Amanda Seyfried On Nudity, Taxidermy and Her ‘Husband’
item.dc:creator: Kate Morawetz
item.description: Amanda Seyfried is playing the angelic Cosette in “Les Miserables”, but don’t let that fool you. The actress is getting candid with InStyle for the cover of their January 2013 issue talking onscreen stripping, her obsession with dead animals and the benefits of having a husband to whom she’s not actually married. Just to clarify,
item.content:encoded:
Amanda Seyfried is playing the angelic Cosette in “Les Miserables”, but don’t let that fool you. The actress is getting candid with InStyle for the cover of their January 2013 issue talking onscreen stripping, her obsession with dead animals and the benefits of having a husband to whom she’s not actually married.

Just to clarify, Amanda is talking about her best friend “Alex! He’s gay. He’s my roommate and practically my husband.” The two met in LA and moved out to New York together and the actress tells the magazine that the two are one day “planning on opening an antiques and curiosities home store, which we want to call Mr. and Mrs. Nesbitt, Nesbitt is his last name.”

Meanwhile, the actress’ curiosity with dead animals started a long time ago, after a trip to Paris when she visited a store called Deyrolle. About her new favourite place to furnish her pad, “It’s one of the biggest taxidermy stores in the world… I love animals so much. From 20-feet away these look real.”

What’s Amanda’s favourite piece? “I have a baby horse named Antoine… Sparkle is a goat; Kevin’s a fox. My baby deer, Sha’Dynasty was the most expensive because I bought her from a French artist in LA. I have a chick named Linda for Linda Lovelace and an owl called Beatrix.”

And on the topic of those pesky nude scenes? Amanda says that “it’s not about me. You’re playing somebody else. You’re not going to believe a love scene if the people are dressed.”  Continuing on, the 27-year-old star explains, “at the same time it has to do with how comfortable you are with letting people see your skin. For me, I’m OK with it.”

But just because she’s okay with letting people see her skin, doesn’t mean that she’s okay with people seeing every part of her. The actress says: “I don’t think I’ll ever show my labia. I’ll keep that under wraps just because of my father and my grandmother. And Finn [her dog]! He’d be so embarassed.”

Catch more from Amanda’s cover shoot when her issue of InStyle hits newsstands December 14 and watch behind-the-scenes with her below!

item.title: Gwen Stefani And Gavin Rossdale’s Duet
item.dc:creator: Sarah Koo
item.description: Gwen Stefani and husband Gavin Rossdale haven’t shared the stage in more than a decade. Although they met and fell in love in 1995 when No Doubt opened for Gavin’s band Bush, they’ve deliberately kept their musical careers separate. So fans at KROQ’s 2012 Almost Acoustic Christmas were pleasantly surprised when superstar Gwen joined her
item.content:encoded:
Gwen Stefani and husband Gavin Rossdale haven’t shared the stage in more than a decade. Although they met and fell in love in 1995 when No Doubt opened for Gavin’s band Bush, they’ve deliberately kept their musical careers separate. So fans at KROQ’s 2012 Almost Acoustic Christmas were pleasantly surprised when superstar Gwen joined her hubby on stage for an impromptu duet of his band’s hit “Glycerine” at the Gibson Amphitheatre in Universal City, California.

Despite recent break-up rumours, the couple who just celebrated their 10th wedding anniversary, put on the PDA by sharing a kiss in the spotlight.

In a throwback to their grunge days, they both injected a little ’90s into their wardrobe. Gwen rocked plaid pants and a mesh see-through top that flaunted her ageless abs, while Gavin paired a leather choker with a sleeveless tee that showed off his pumped pipes.

The 43-year-old “Settle Down” singer thrilled the crowed when she appeared onstage for the song’s second verse, while her equally youthful 47-year-old husband played hard on his guitar. Watch one of music’s fittest couples sing together in the video below.

item.title: Bryan Adams Gets ‘Exposed’ in LA
item.dc:creator: Kate Morawetz
item.description: It’s no secret anymore what Canadian rock legend Bryan Adams’ hobby is. With the release of his new photography book Exposed, the singer is giving fans a look inside some of his famous friendships with a few “magical moments” in between. We recently caught up with Bryan at an LA book signing and the musician
item.content:encoded:
It’s no secret anymore what Canadian rock legend Bryan Adams’ hobby is. With the release of his new photography book Exposed, the singer is giving fans a look inside some of his famous friendships with a few “magical moments” in between.

We recently caught up with Bryan at an LA book signing and the musician had a few things to say about some very famous faces featured in his book.

“Most of the pictures in this book are a result of things that happened for magazines so they’re all published, most of them, except for the pictures of Amy Winehouse,” he admits.

Bryan went on to explain that every picture has a memory and shares a particularly candid one of the late Amy Winehouse. “There’s one where I’ve taken a picture of her driving my car and I’d actually been teaching her earlier in the day how to drive,” he reveals. “I was always having to hold onto the hand break, otherwise she was crashing into things. Which is an interesting parallel, because I don’t think Amy had brakes on anything.”

Another famous face to both Bryan and Amy is Elton John, who’s not only featured in the pages, but gracefully wrote the forward to the book.

So what’s next for Bryan? Well he’s recently tweeted some very happy news that he and Alicia Grimaldi are pregnant with their second child.

Watch more with Bryan Adams below and if you’re a fan be sure to check out our Holiday Gift Guide this week for your chance to win a copy of Exposed!
